Package it.polimi.ingsw.client.modelview

Class PlayerView

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.client.modelview.PlayerView
All Implemented Interfaces:
Transmittable, java.io.Serializable
public class PlayerView
extends java.lang.Object
implements Transmittable
Contains all the views related to one player.
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private FaithTrackView faithTrackView
    Player's personal Faith Track, handles faith points and pope favor tiles.
    private boolean isMyTurn
    True if it's the player's turn, false otherwise.
    private java.util.List<LeaderCard> leaderCards
    All leader cards, both active and not.
    private boolean mainAction
    True if the player can still perform their action for this turn, false if it has already been used.
    private java.lang.String nickname
    The player's nickname, used to identify them in case of reconnection.
    private java.util.List<SlotView> slots
    List of board production, development card slots and special productions.
    private StrongboxView strongboxView
    Infinite depot where the production outputs are stored.
    private java.util.List<Resource> tempResources
    Resources acquired from market and not yet deposited.
    private java.util.List<DepotView> warehouse
    List of depots and special depots

    • getTotalResources

      public Resource getTotalResources​(ResourceType type)
      Returns the total resources one player possesses for one type.
      Parameters:
      type - the ResourceType to get the total of.
      Returns:
      Resource that represents the total the player possesses.

    • getTotalResources

      public Resource[] getTotalResources()
      Getter for the sum of all player resources.
      Returns:
      Resource array with the total of all resources the player possesses.

    • canPay

      public boolean canPay​(Resource[] cost)
      Checks whether the player has enough resources to pay.
      Parameters:
      cost - Resource array of the required resources.
      Returns:
      true if player has enough, false otherwise.
